title: DSA Basics: Arrays & Linked Lists
description: Test your understanding of fundamental data structures

questions.question: What is the time complexity of accessing an element in an array by index?
questions.explanation: Array access by index is O(1) because arrays use direct memory addressing.

questions.question: Which data structure follows LIFO (Last In First Out) principle?
questions.explanation: Stack follows LIFO - the last element added is the first one removed.

questions.question: What is the main advantage of a linked list over an array?
questions.explanation: Linked lists can grow or shrink dynamically, while arrays have fixed size.

questions.question: A doubly linked list allows traversal in both directions.
questions.explanation: Yes, doubly linked lists have pointers to both next and previous nodes.

questions.question: What is the time complexity of inserting at the beginning of a linked list?
questions.explanation: Insertion at the head of a linked list is O(1) - just update the head pointer.
